data.title: 2024 Class Day Awards Ceremony
data.meta_description: The HKS community came together for the Class Day Awards Ceremony on Wednesday, May 22, 2024 in John F. Kennedy Memorial Park to celebrate the achievements of members of the Class of 2024 and faculty and staff members who supported them along the way.
data.text:
Barbara Jordan Award for Women’s Leadership

For a graduating student at Harvard Kennedy School for her/his/their commitment to build community and serve as a role model for women aspiring to be leaders. Presented by Iris Bohnet, Albert Pratt Professor of Business and Government and the co-director of the Women and Public Policy Program.

Safira Putri MPP 2024

Jane Mansbridge Research Award

For an outstanding research paper—Policy Analysis Exercise, Second Year Policy Analysis, or others—whose analysis of an organization or topic is focused on women or gender. Presented by Iris Bohnet, Albert Pratt Professor of Business and Government and the co-director of the Women and Public Policy Program.

Aditi Kothari MPP 2024 | "Cooling the Divide: Building Gender-Inclusive Urban Heat Resilience"

Holly Taylor Sargent Award for Women’s Advancement

For a member of the Harvard Kennedy School community (faculty, staff, or student) who has done the most to advance the opportunities, situation, and status of women within the HKS community. Presented by Iris Bohnet, Albert Pratt Professor of Business and Government and the co-director of the Women and Public Policy Program.

Tram T. Nguyen MC/MPA 2024

Taubman Center Urban Prize

For an outstanding paper on a topic related to state or local urban issues. Presented by Jeffrey Liebman, Robert W. Scrivner Professor of Social Policy and Director of the Taubman Center for State and Local Government, Rappaport Institute for Greater Boston, and Government Performance Lab.

co-winners:

Maya Alper MPP 2024 | "Digital Service Delivery for Stronger Communities"

Sarah Ballinger MPP 2024 | "Designing a Compensation Philosophy for the City of Boston"

Prize for Outstanding Second Year Policy Analysis

The Second Year Policy Analysis is an important part of the MPA/ID Program, a capstone project, in which students choose a real-world policy problem to address through a final paper. Presented by Dani Rodrik, Ford Foundation Professor of International Political Economy and Faculty Chair, MPA/ID Program and Carol Finney, Director, MPA/ID Program.

Amitha Ablud Jayaram MPA/ID 2024 | "Mitigation of Groundwater Depletion in India"

Maria Andreina Cantele Sáenz MPA/ID 2024 and Catalina Reyes Villegas MPA/ID 2024 | "Teacher Shortage in Venezuela: Leveraging Positive Deviance in a Humanitarian Setting"

Rushabh Sanghvi MPA/ID 2024 and Leandro Urbano MPA/ID 2024 | "Charging Ahead: A Supply Chain and Capability Perspective on India's EV Industrial Policy"

Raymond Vernon Award for Commitment to International Development

For a graduating MPA/ID student who best personifies the values of the program, namely dedication to international development, good citizenship, academic excellence, and strong potential to lead and contribute to the field. Presented by Dani Rodrik, Ford Foundation Professor of International Political Economy and Faculty Chair, MPA/ID Program and Carol Finney, Director, MPA/ID Program.

Miguel Molina MPA/ID 2024

Yuji Sano MPA/ID 2024

2024 Class Gift

For future students who need financial support to make their Harvard Kennedy School education possible. Total dollars and donors from the campaign will be announced.

Presented to Douglas W. Elmendorf, Dean and Don K. Price Professor of Public Policy by the Class of 2024 Gift Committee and Matching Gift Committee.

Donald K. Price Award

For MPA students who embody the strengths of the program—through academic excellence, community-building, or demonstrations of leadership within the class.

Presented by Kessley Hong, Senior Lecturer in Public Policy and Faculty Chair of MPA Programs and the Mid-Career MPA Summer Program, and Emma Heffern, Director, MPA Programs.

Rohan Manish Chandra MPA 2024

Kelsey Baer Hayes MPA 2024

Mrinalini Mrinalini MPA 2024

Alexandros Dave Pamnani MPA 2024

Lucius N. Littauer Award

For MC/MPA students who embody the strengths of the program—through academic excellence, community-building, or demonstrations of leadership within the class.

Presented by Kessley Hong, Senior Lecturer in Public Policy and Faculty Chair of MPA Programs and the Mid-Career MPA Summer Program, and Emma Heffern, Director, MPA Programs.

Saidzhan Abdullaev MC/MPA 2024

Sara Bin Mahfooz MC/MPA 2024

Additional Awards

Mason Certificate Ceremony

Tuesday, May 21 | John F. Kennedy Memorial Park

The Mason Certificate Ceremony was a joyful celebration to recognize the achievements of the HKS Class of 2024 MC/MPA Mason Fellows. Many graduating students and their families and friends wore traditional dress from their home countries or regions.
